revised_title: Subsidence and Structural Control in Southeastern England: Basement Influence on Mesozoic Rocks in the Strait of Dover Region
tldr: This article discusses the geological structures and deformational history of southeastern England, focusing on the influence of the basement control on the Mesozoic rocks in the Strait of Dover region. The authors review current information and opinions on the structures of concealed Palaeozoic rocks and present new data from marine gravity measurements. They also analyze the regional structure and discuss the implications of the Hercynian orogeny on the area.
